conclusion: Analyze both horizontal and vertical components of projectile's motion.
Initial velocity is launched at an angle to the horizontal.
Decompose initial velocity into horizontal and vertical components.
Horizontal velocity remains constant due to no horizontal acceleration.
Determine time of flight using horizontal distance and velocity.
Calculate time of flight: t = 2 s.
Projectile falls vertically under gravity during time t.
Use equation of motion for vertical displacement to find height H.
Determine height at which projectile hits building: H = 100 m.
